page.title: 04GRETTON PARISH CHURCH
page.content:
Gretton Parish Church is dedicated to St. James. It was built in the eleventh century, probably from local ironstone and some stone from further afield. In the twelfth century, side aisles were added. Three hundred years later the tower was built which houses the five bells. In the eighteenth century, the floor of the chancel was raised in order that the Hatton family (the Lord's of the Manor of Gretton) could have a family vault underneath.
Since the first church records were kept, there have been fifty-five vicars, the longest reigning incumbent being a Robert Graham who was vicar for forty-one years during the reign of King George III.
